intro: Collomia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its showy, tubular flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds dispersed by wind.
